required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Tirzepatide (LY3298176) in Participants With Type 2 Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, 3-Month Trial of LY3298176 Versus Placebo in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the efficacy of tirzepatide in participants with type 2 diabetes.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Haemoglobin A1c (HbA1c)
primary_outcome.description: Least squares (LS) mean was calculated using mixed model repeated measures model (MMRM) with baseline + baseline BMI group + baseline metformin flag + treatment + time + treatment*time as fixed factors.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving HbA1c Target of <7.0%
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants achieving HbA1c target of < (less than) 7.0%.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Fasting Blood Glucose (FBG)
secondary_outcome.description: LSMean was calculated using MMRM model with baseline + baseline HbA1C group + baseline BMI group + baseline Metformin flag + treatment + time + treatment*time as fixed factors.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Body Weight
secondary_outcome.description: LSMean was calculated using MMRM model with baseline + baseline HbA1C group + baseline BMI group + baseline Metformin flag + treatment + time + treatment*time as fixed factors.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Waist Circumference
secondary_outcome.description: LSMean was calculated using MMRM model with baseline + baseline HbA1C group + baseline BMI group + baseline Metformin flag + treatment + time + treatment*time as fixed factors.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Anti Drug Antibodies
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with anti drug antibodies.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Episodes of Total Hypoglycemia Episodes
secondary_outcome.description: Number of episodes of total hypoglycemia episodes with plasma glucose <= ( less than or equal to) 54 mg/dL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics (PK): Average Trough Concentration (Conctrough) of Tirzepatide
secondary_outcome.description: Pharmacokinetics (PK): Average Trough Concentration (Conctrough) of Tirzepatide.

arm_group.description: Participants received Tirzepatide by subcutaneous (SC) injection in three dose escalations starting with 4 milligrams (mg) for four weeks followed by 8mg for four weeks followed by 12mg for four weeks.

Participants received Tirzepatide by SC injection in four dose escalations starting with 2.5mg for two weeks followed by 5mg for two weeks followed by 10mg for four weeks followed by 15mg for four weeks.
Participants received Tirzepatide by SC injection in three dose escalations starting with 2.5mg for four weeks followed by 7.5mg for four weeks followed by 15mg for four weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Have type 2 diabetes (T2DM) for ≥6 months according to the Criteria for Diagnosing Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus (American Diabetes Association 2017).
- Have HbA1c of 7.0% to 10.5%, inclusive, as assessed by the central laboratory.
- If on metformin, have been treated with stable doses of metformin for at least 3 months.
- Have a body mass index (BMI) between 23 and 45 (Inclusive) kilograms per square meter.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have type 1 diabetes (T1D).
- Have used any glucose-lowering medication other than metformin within 3 months prior to study entry or during screening/lead-in period or have used any glucagon-like peptide-1 receptor agonists (GLP-1 RAs) at any time in the past 12 months.
- Have had any of the following cardiovascular conditions: acute myocardial infarction (MI), New York Heart Association Class III or Class IV heart failure, or cerebrovascular accident (stroke).
- Have acute or chronic hepatitis, signs and symptoms of any other liver disease other than nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD), or alanine aminotransferase (ALT) level >2.5 times the upper limit of the reference range, as determined by the central laboratory at study entry; participants with NAFLD are eligible for participation in this trial.
- Have had chronic or acute pancreatitis any time prior to study entry.
- Have an estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) <45 milliliters/minute/1.73 square meter, calculated by the Chronic Kidney Disease-Epidemiology (CKD-EPI) equation.
- Have serum calcitonin ≥20 picograms per milliliter, as determined by the central laboratory at study entry.
- Have any condition that is a contraindication for use of the GLP-1 RA class (per country-specific labels) at study entry or develop such condition between study entry and randomization.

overall_official.last_name: Call 1-877-CTLILLY (1-877-285-4559) or 1-317-615-4559 Mon - Fri 9 AM - 5 PM Eastern time (UTC/GMT - 5 hours, EST)

facility.name: Cotton O'Neil Diabetes and Endocrinology Center

link.description: A Study of Tirzepatide in Participants With Type 2 Diabetes

patient_data.ipd_description: Anonymized individual patient level data will be provided in a secure access environment upon approval of a research proposal and a signed data sharing agreement.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data are available 6 months after the primary publication and approval of the indication studied in the US and EU, whichever is later. Data will be indefinitely available for requesting.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: A research proposal must be approved by an independent review panel and researchers must sign a data sharing agreement.

group.description: Participants received Placebo by subcutaneous (SC) injection.

group.description: Participants received Tirzepatide by SC injection in three dose escalations starting with 4mg for four weeks followed by 8mg for four weeks followed by 12mg for four weeks.

group.title: 2.5, 5, 10, and 15mg Tirzepatide
group.description: Participants received Tirzepatide by SC injection in four dose escalations starting with 2.5mg for two weeks followed by 5mg for two weeks followed by 10mg for four weeks followed by 15mg for four weeks.

group.title: 2.5, 7.5 and 15mg Tirzepatide
group.description: Participants received Tirzepatide by SC injection in three dose escalations starting with 2.5mg for four weeks followed by 7.5mg for four weeks followed by 15mg for four weeks.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Haemoglobin A1c (HbA1c)
outcome.description: Least squares (LS) mean was calculated using mixed model repeated measures model (MMRM) with baseline + baseline BMI group + baseline metformin flag + treatment + time + treatment*time as fixed factors.
outcome.population: All participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug and had baseline and at least one post baseline data. Participants who discontinued study drug or initiated rescue drug were excluded.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
